sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arcsin function is used to find the arc sine of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, arcsin (0.5) is p / 6.
sections.mdown_content: The **arcsin** function is used to find the arc sine of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, **arcsin** (0.5) is p / 6.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : -4 .. 4
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc sine of ", arg, " is ",
                arcsin (arg), " radians"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arcsine of -1 through 1 in radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arcsine of -1 through 1 in radians.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arccos and arctan functions for calculating arccosine and arctangent.

the arcsind function which finds the arc sine of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arccos.html](arccos)** and **[arctan.html](arctan)** functions for calculating arccosine and arctangent.
the **[arcsind.html](arcsind)** function which finds the arc sine of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
